div.style: padding: 10px; border: 2px solid rgb(153, 0, 0); color: rgb(153, 0, 0); text-align: left;
div.strong: UPDATE 4/17/20 - Gov. Pritzker Announces All Illinois Schools to Remain Closed for Remainder of 2019-20 School Year

br.p: Today Governor J.B. Pritzker extended the school closings for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year as a method to curtail the growing number of COVID-19 cases in Illinois.
All CM 201-U buildings will remain closed. Phone calls will be transferred remotely between 9:00 am - 3:00 pm.

strong.a: Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker says schools will be closed to in-person learning for remainder of academic year (Chicago Tribune)

a.title: Illinois.gov
a.strong: Gov. Pritzker Announces Extension of Stay at Home Order, Suspension of On-Site Learning in Schools Through April (Illinois News - Illinois.gov)

a.title: View article on Chicago Tribune website

a.title: Letter to the CMHS Senior Class

img.alt: Letter to the CMHS Senior Class

div.div: Letter to the CMHS Senior Class
While COVID-19 has resulted in the closure of schools throughout the state and around the country, no group of students has been more impacted by this crisis than you, our high school seniors.
VIEW MORE About Letter to the CMHS Senior Class

a.title: Letter to the CMMS 8th Grade Class

img.alt: Letter to the CMMS 8th Grade Class

div.div: Letter to the CMMS 8th Grade Class

While COVID-19 has resulted in the closure of schools throughout the state and around the country, we recognize the impact on students like you – our 8 th graders – who are forced to forgo exciting ceremonies that commemorate and celebrate your hard work.

div.p: Crete-Monee School District 201-U's mission is to empower each student to positively impact the world for a bright new future.

Just 30 minutes south of Chicago, Crete-Monee School District 201-U is located in a dynamic, largely professional, south suburban community. This award-winning district boasts one of the most envied mathematics programs in the State of Illinois, a national championship choral music program and a full menu of varsity athletics. With a growing population of over 5,000 students in grades K-12, School District 201-U represents a wide range of social, cultural and religious backgrounds.
